overview:
## Discussion

Alternate single image component setter.

This convenience method simplifies modifying the components of an `NSDraggingItem` when there is only one component. It sets the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/draggingFrame] and creates a single [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingImageComponent] instance with one image corresponding to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/ImageComponentKey/icon] key. You should use this method only under the following conditions: the drag image for this item is composed of a single image, or there are a reasonable number of dragging item instances being created or enumerated.

If your application requires the dragging of hundreds of items this method would create a instance for each item when it is called. Compare this to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponentsProvider] block which is much faster to define and allows AppKit to create only a subset of the items using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponentsProvider].

This method sets the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/draggingFrame] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponents] properties.

# setDraggingFrame(_:contents:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the item’s dragging frame and contents.

## Declaration

```swift
func setDraggingFrame(_ frame: NSRect, contents: Any?)
```

## Parameters

- **frame**: The item content frame, which is in the same coordinate space as the value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/draggingFrame].
- **contents**: The item contents to display when dragging. Typically this is an `NSImage`, but a `CGImageRef` will also work.

## Discussion

Alternate single image component setter.

This convenience method simplifies modifying the components of an `NSDraggingItem` when there is only one component. It sets the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/draggingFrame] and creates a single [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingImageComponent] instance with one image corresponding to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/ImageComponentKey/icon] key. You should use this method only under the following conditions: the drag image for this item is composed of a single image, or there are a reasonable number of dragging item instances being created or enumerated.

If your application requires the dragging of hundreds of items this method would create a instance for each item when it is called. Compare this to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponentsProvider] block which is much faster to define and allows AppKit to create only a subset of the items using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponentsProvider].

This method sets the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/draggingFrame] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDraggingItem/imageComponents] properties.

## Related Documentation

- **imageComponentsProvider**: An array of blocks that provide the dragging image components.

## Dragging frame

- **draggingFrame**: The frame of the dragging item.
